item.title: 2019 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The rugged mountain elevations have complex marine Franciscan Formation soils with metamorphosed marine sediments such as Haire loam Cole silt loam Fagan clay loam and Felton gravelly loam with small amounts of more recent Sonoma Volcanic soils. The cool Mt. Veeder appellation overlooking the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly developing incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes. We have Cabernet clones 4 7 337 and 191 planted to these steep hills grafted to 1103P and 101-14 rootstock. The vines are spaced at 9 ft. between rows and 4 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley and in most years it is last cabernet harvested for V. Sattui.
item.summary: 94 POINTS - Wine & Spirits Magazine

item.title: 2019 Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Combining 86% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc, 2% Malbec, and 2% Petit Verdot, this blend imparts robust aromas of blackberry and currant with sweet tobacco, cedar and black pepper notes in the bouquet. It’s mouthwatering acidity and supple mouthfeel highlight dark fruit profiles of plum and black cherry that are rounded out by structured tannins on the finish.Vineyard Notes:Our 2019 Napa Valley Cabernet is sourced from many of our best estate and grower vineyards in the Napa Valley and its sub-appellations.; Rutherford is famous for its dusty, earthy qualities and fragrant black cherry fruit. Our Estate “Vittorio’s Vineyard” adjacent to the winery provides smooth Cabernet Sauvignon and the powerful intensity of Petit Verdot to the blend. Mt. Veeder provides excellent color and supple tannins; Coombsville brings intense black color and fine-grain tannins.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Wine Competition

item.title: 2019 Paradiso
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Paradiso is the proprietary name for our red “Meritage” - a Bordeaux-style blend that changes in varietal composition from vintage to vintage. In an homage to this type of wine, we have included five of classic grape varietals, with no single variety making up more than 90% of the blend. The beauty of this is that no one varietal stands out, but that each one is harmoniously balanced by the others. These wines are prized for the smooth, silky textures and complex, full-bodied structure. They age beautifully for decades; however, most are also very drinkable in their younger years.
item.summary: BEST BORDEAUX-STYLE BLEND, 96 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2019 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Preston Vineyard is located in the Rutherford Appellation, where some of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. This was one of the first cabernet vineyards that Dario Sattui was drawn to in the early years. It is a very small region of Napa, known for its gravelly soils which produce rich, alluring and opulent red wines with fine-grained tannins and incredible complexity. The alluvial soils from Mount St. John have washed down from the hills over millennia to create a unique layering of weathered rock and gravel mixed with clay. The vines are 40-plus years old, 10’ X 8’ spacing and trained to a divided canopy, or “Quad”. The trellis allows ample light penetration on the fruit creating perfect flavor development and excellent maturity in the grapes at harvest.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & CELLAR SELECTION - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2019 Terra Forza Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Dedicated to Sustainability - Committed to Change:Beyond our own commitments towards environmental resiliency and stewardship, V. Sattui Winery is also supportive of organizations making positive changes for the environment and the community. For every bottle sold of the 2019 Napa Valley Terra Forza, either at the winery or online, V. Sattui Winery will donate a portion of the sales to Napa Green - aglobal leader in sustainable wine-growing, setting the highest bar for sustainability and climate action in the wine industry. Napa Green facilitates systematic soil-to-bottle certification for wineries and vineyards, providing vital resources, tools, and connections necessary for Napa to become leaders in stewardship and sustainability. Learn more.Thank you for joining us in supporting these vital efforts through your purchase of this special Cabernet. Vineyard Notes:Our 2019 Terra Forza Cabernet Sauvignon is an eloquent blend that showcases the opulence of Napa Valley. We sought out to create a wine that was as robust as the Valley’s reputation, incorporating powerhouse varietals from our estate vineyards in St. Helena, Rutherford, and Mount Veeder.
item.summary: 94 POINTS & PLATINUM - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2019 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton Loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’ and rows are slightly north of east-west and grown to a VSP trellis. These well-drained gravelly soils promote early-ripening and optimum maturity and they are often the first Cabernet grapes of the harvest. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012.
item.summary: 96 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2020 Cara Chardonnay
item.description: "With this special bottling of Chardonnay I dedicate this wine to my wife Cara. Like Katarina before her Cara is a very strong forthright determined and loving woman. Cara and I met as co-workers here at V. Sattui Winery 41 years ago and two years later we were married! I marvel and celebrate strong women that balance family work and community and that is the inspiration behind the naming of this wine!" - V. Sattui Winery President Tom DaviesVineyard Notes:Our 2020 Cara Chardonnay is a unique blend of fruit sourced from our estate properties Hibbard Ranch (32%) in Los Carneros and Carsi Vineyard (68%) in Yountville. These properties are located toward the cool southern end of Napa Valley where fog from the San Pablo Bay helps regulate temperature throughout the growing season. The coastal influence of the bay keeps daytime temperatures cool allowing grapes to develop slowly ripen evenly and develop full varietal flavors.

item.title: 2020 Duarte Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard NotesThe Duarte Vineyard consists of two small Zinfandel blocks one planted in 1981 and the other in 2014 to 5BB rootstock. It is dry farmed in most years and the soils are very sandy and extremely well-drained. The warmer summer temperatures are moderated with strong and cooling breezes from the bay to create the perfect growing conditions for these vines.
item.summary: 92 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2020 Entanglement (gsm)
item.description: Vineyards Notes: Our Entanglement is a delightful blend featuring Grenache, Syrah and Mourvédre (GSM). Our Grenache and Syrah are sourced from our Carsi Vineyard estate located in Yountville. This 27-acre vineyard was named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. Yountville has a combination of soil types and micro climates that make this location perfect for growing different varietals. Our Mourvédre comes from Vittorio’s Vineyard located at our estate in St Helena, where only half an acre is planted. Last, but certainly not least we incorporate a touch of our Petite Sirah, which adds a dash of its characteristic rich, purple color, and recognizably deep fruity flavor.
item.summary: 92 Points & Gold - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2020 Napa Valley Grenache
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2020 Napa Valley Grenache utilizes fruit sourced completely from our own estate ranch Carsi Vineyard in Yountville. While this wine is made of predominantly Grenache, we sought to blend in just a touch of Syrah, which lends some dark fruit and slightly peppery characteristics. Our vines are spaced at 7ft. between the rows and 4ft. between the vines and row direction is generally North-South on a v. vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system. This arrangement forces grape clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.
item.summary: DOUBLE GOLD - SF Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2020 Pilgrim Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Pilgrim Vineyard is a 12-acre parcel located in the Lodi AVA, which lies just between Sacramento and Stockton, extending east until it runs into the Sierra Foothills AVA. This lovely vineyard is owned by Joel and Martine Herche, who after moving sixteen times in sixteen years, ended their pilgrimage in 1998 by finally settling down on this vineyard. They playfully named it for John Bunyan’s work, “The Pilgrim’s Progress”. The vines are certified to be at least 70 years old, but are reputed to be much older and are flourishing.
item.summary: 91 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2020 Reserve Stock Chardonnay Napa Valley
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2020 Reserve Stock Chardonnay is crafted to reflect the premier quality of our estate grown Chardonnay, with a bold accompaniment of rich toasted oak that has been imparted over the nine months of sur-lees barrel aging in 100% New French Oak. For this vintage, about 50% of the blend is composed of fruit sourced from Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros, 38% from Carsi Vineyard in Yountville, and the remaining 12% from Collina d’ Oro Vineyard in the Russian River Valley of Sonoma County. These three appellations are well-known throughout both Napa and Sonoma Counties for producing the highest quality Chardonnay, and this wine is here to prove it!
item.summary: 93 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2020 Sattui Family Red
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2020 Sattui Family Red is a delightful combination of fruit that has been sourced from our three estate properties: Carsi Vineyard, Vittorio’s Vineyard and Hibbard Ranch. Each appellation brings its own characteristic terroir to the finalized blend while a few select varietals intermingle beautifully in a yummy, easy drinking and satisfying wine - perfect for any day of the week.

item.title: 2021 Amador Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:John Murrill’s Zinfandel vines at Amador Ridge Vineyard are located just outside of Sutter Creek on an ancient mud-slide of red cobbly-loam soil. The head-trained Zinfandel is grafted to St. George rootstock on an east-facing slope allowing him to dry-farm in most seasons and to irrigate the vines only in exceptionally dry years. John practices sustainable farming and yield are only 2 to 2 ½ tons per acre on average.
item.summary: 90 POINTS & GOLD - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Bacci (red Blend)
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Bacci is a proprietary blend that incorporates our three estate properties: Carsi Vineyard, Vittorio’s Vineyard, and Hibbard Ranch. We sought out to create a unique blend that showcased some of our favorite varietals grown in these vineyards that demonstrate luscious fresh fruit flavor with soft round tannins. This wine has every bit of character that one would want in a red wine without the need to wait for aging!

item.title: 2021 Black-sears Zinfandel (howell Mountain)
item.description: Vineyard NotesBlack-Sears Vineyard, located in the Howell Mountain sub-appellation of Napa Valley, is one of the most prestigious hillsides in the AVA. It was planted in 1975 and at an elevation of 2400 ft., is one of the highest vineyards in Napa County. Influenced by the local topography, temperature variation is high here, as the vineyard sits above the fog line that serves as a climate moderator to the valley below. Grapes bask in the sunshine by day allowing them to develop intense color and flavor but cool down overnight allowing them to retain their acidity and structure. The soil types here are also influenced by topography, and tend to be very thin, dry, and lacking in nutrients; long been considered conducive to quality fruit production as vines produced smaller more intensely flavored fruit with bountiful tannin structure and excellent aging potential.
item.summary: BEST ZINFANDEL; 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay showcases fruit solely from our 27-acre estate vineyard, named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. There are three Chardonnay blocks each planted to showcase a unique clone of Chardonnay. Clones 95 and 76 are Dijon clones which are lower yielding, with small clusters and concentrated flavors, while clone 809 characteristically has a more floral aroma. These Chardonnay vines were planted in 1999 on a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions. Summer average temperatures range from 50º to 90ºF which makes it ideal site for these varietals. Cool summer nights retain the acidity and hot days bring the maturity to perfection.
item.summary: BEST CHARDONNAY, 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2021 Collins Family Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard NotesThe Collins Family, Block 20 Zinfandel was planted in 1923 on an alluvial fan on the north end of the St. Helena Appellation and is adjacent to the Historic Bale Gristmill. The traditional head-trained vines are grafted to St. George rootstock and this years’ harvest marks the vines 96th birthday! The yields average less than 3 tons per acre, and the soil is very well-drained with lots of large stones and gravel that has been washed down from the steep Mayacamas Mountain Range to the West.

item.title: 2021 Entanglement (gsm)
item.description: Vineyard Notes:A majority of the blend (50%) comes from Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This appellation lies on the border of both Napa and Sonoma Counties, but unlike other cool-climate AVA’s in Sonoma County, Los Carneros receives much less rainfall, and it is farther from the ocean. The area’s dense, clay soils are not particularly deep or fertile, and these factors when combined produce fruit with concentrated flavors.We also source grapes for this wine from just down the road at our other estate property, Carsi Vineyard (40%) located in Yountville. It is a 27-acre vineyard named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. This appellation is one of the coolest wine growing regions in Napa Valley, which contributes to a long growing season and full-flavored fruit.The remainder of the blend (10%) comes from Vittorio’s Vineyard located at our estate in St Helena, and is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather, who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012. The Quantum Entanglements of Wine A certain magic occurs when combining three distinct varietals before fermentation as compared to after fermentation. This very magic occurs in the production of our newly released and oh-so-delicious 2012 Entanglement (GSM); a Rhone-style blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Winery President Tom Davies and his friend and Professor of Physics at UCLA, Seth Putterman brainstormed on how to name this new Sattui wine and were inspired by Einstein’s discovery of Quantum Entanglement which Einstein called “spooky action at a distance.” Entanglement is the basis of quantum computing which in 15 years will give us computers where 35quantum bits equal today’s terabit. Entanglement occurs when the measurement of one particle affects the state of another particle that can even be far away. “What an appropriate name for a complex wine where each wonderful sip tastes teasingly different,” notes Putterman. Each varietal dynamically interacts to create something all-together new and exciting.
item.summary: BEST RHONE BLEND; 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l. Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Gilsson Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Gilsson Vineyard is located along the Eastern section of the Russian River Valley Appellation in Sonoma County. The vines were planted in the early 1960s to St. George rootstock and are head-trained and spur-pruned. The soil consists of old, weathered “Laughlin Series” clay loam. The nutrients from these soils are tightly bound to microscopic clay particles and thus are not readily available which makes the vines work harder for survival. This struggle translates to a lower fruit production per vine, but higher quality grapes with concentrated flavors.
item.summary: 93 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2021 La Merica
item.description: About La Merica: Our 2021 La Merica celebrates and honors our winery’s Italian heritage with a modern interpretation of a classic pre-prohibition blend. Though proprietary by nature this wine is largely composed from grape varietals sourced from our estate vineyards Carsi Vineyard and Hibbard Ranch. The star players in this powerhouse blend are some of the key Rhone varietals like Syrah, Petite Sirah, and Grenache along with a few unlikely candidates mixed in to spice things up!“I wanted to make a wine that celebrated and honored our winery’s Italian heritage with a modern interpretation of a classic pre-prohibition blend. For over 150 years in California, Petite Sirah and Zinfandel have been planted side-by-side and are natural blending partners – with Petite Sirah providing the color, spice, and structure, and Zinfandel contributing its varietal distinctive dark berry fruit and aromas. Our new-world blend takes these classic grapes and steers away from the rustic old-world style and boldly produces a wine filled with deeply dark-fruited flavors inky-purple color and supple and lingering textures.In searching for name for this special wine I came across a paper given to me by Dr. Victor Geraci a noted wine historian and professor at UC Berkeley during our 125th Anniversary of V. Sattui in 2010. In his paper he spoke of the mass Italian immigration of the late 1800s and early 1900s with many of these immigrants finding a home and work in the nascent California winegrowing business. In the dialect of their native tongue they affectionately referred to their new home in America as La Merica.La Merica honors these brave men, women, and children that left a home filled with poverty and political hardship to a new home filled with hope and opportunity. I want this wine to embrace the importance of immigration not only as the foundation and building blocks of our great country but also for our future and continued greatness as a nation of immigrants. La Merica rejoices everything that is great about America: Freedom, Transparency, Opportunity, Choice, Due Process, Acceptance, and Diversity.” – V. Sattui President Tom Davies
item.summary: TRIPLE GOLD - Dan Berger's Int'l Wine Comp.

item.title: 2021 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:This wine comes from Gary & Melody Morisoli’s Vineyard located in the heart of the famed “Rutherford Bench” below Mt. St. John in the Mayacamas range. Gary is a third-generation farmer in a special part of Napa Valley known for well-drained Bale Clay Loam gravelly soils producing fine- grain supple tannins in the wine and where some of the best Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. The vine rows are oriented on a direction that is slightly North-west by South-East with a “V-trellis” that allows optimum filtered light to hit the ripening grape clusters. Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon is grafted to 110R rootstock on this very cobbly and rocky ground. Gary typically uses very limited irrigation during the growing season essentially dry-farming in most years. The vines were planted in 1990 and V. Sattui has been harvesting these grape to make a single-vineyard designate since the first small harvest of 1993.
item.summary: 94 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The rugged mountain elevations have complex marine Franciscan Formation soils with metamorphosed marine sediments such as Haire loam Cole silt loam Fagan clay loam and Felton gravelly loam with small amounts of more recent Sonoma Volcanic soils. The cool Mt. Veeder appellation overlooking the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly developing incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes. We have Cabernet clones 4, 7, 337, and 191 planted to these steep hills grafted to 1103P and 101-14 rootstock. The vines are spaced at 9 ft. between rows and 4 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley and in most years it is last cabernet harvested for V. Sattui.
item.summary: 94 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Napa Valley Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Our 2021 Napa Valley Chardonnay is made from a delightful blend of our estate vineyard fruit. A majority of which comes from Hibbard Ranch (68%) located in Los Carneros. This appellation lies on the border of both Napa and Sonoma Counties, but unlike other cool-climate AVA’s in Sonoma County, Los Carneros receives much less rainfall, and it is farther from the ocean. The area’s dense, clay soils are not particularly deep or fertile, and these factors when combined create a powerful Chardonnay with concentrated fruit flavors.We also chose to incorporate a touch of the fruit (18%) from Carsi Vineyard, just down the road in Yountville. It is a 27-acre vineyard named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. This appellation is one of the coolest wine growing regions in Napa Valley, which contributes to a long growing season and full-flavored fruit.A small component of the final blend (14%) also includes fruit from our Russian River Valley Estate “Collina d’Oro. This climate promotes full flavor maturity over an extended growing season, while allowing the fruit to retain its natural acidity. The combination of fractured sandstone and sandy loam soils allow the vineyards to retain water and heat, which help to produce smooth, round wines with less acidity that are highly aromatic.
item.summary: 92 POINTS - Lisa Perrotti-Brown, The Wine Independent

item.title: 2021 Napa Valley Grenache
item.description: Vineyard NotesThe grapes for our 2021 Napa Valley Grenache are sourced completely from our own estate ranches. A majority (73%) of the blend comes from Carsi Vineyard located in Yountville. It is a 27-acre vineyard named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. This appellation is one of the coolest wine growing regions in Napa Valley, which contributes to a long growing season and full-flavored fruit.The remainder of the blend (27%) is sourced from just down the road at Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This appellation lies on the border of both Napa and Sonoma Counties, but unlike other cool-climate AVA’s in Sonoma County, Los Carneros receives much less rainfall, and it is farther from the ocean. The area’s dense, clay soils are not particularly deep or fertile, and these factors when combined create a powerful Chardonnay with concentrated fruit flavors.
item.summary:
BEST GRENACHE; 92 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge
This wine is currently available only to Wine-of-the-Month Club members.

item.title: 2021 Napa Valley Malbec
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2021 Napa Valley Malbec sources grapes from our estate vineyard located in Yountville. It is a 27-acre vineyard named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. Yountville has a combination of soil types and micro climates that make this location perfect for growing different varietals. We’ve selected Malbec clone 595, which is praised for its intense dark color and pronounced fruit characteristics reflected in both the aroma and palate of its wines. These vines were planted in 2010, on a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system, which forces fruit clusters to the outside of the canopy in order to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance their ripening. Summer average temperatures range from 50ºF to 90ºF which makes it ideal site for these varietals. Cool summer nights retain the acidity and hot days bring the maturity to perfection
item.summary: BEST MALBEC; 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2021 Napa Valley Merlot
item.description: Vineyard NotesThe cool Mt. Veeder appellation, overlooking the San Pablo Bay, allows the fruit to mature slowly, developing incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes. Rugged mountain elevations have complex, marine Franciscan Formation soils, with metamorphosed marine sediments, such as Haire loam, Cole silt loam, Fagan clay loam, and Felton gravelly loam with small amounts of more recent Sonoma Volcanic soils. We have Merlot clones 181, and 18 planted to these steep hills, grafted to 101-14 rootstock. The vines are spaced at 7 ft. between rows and 5 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley.
item.summary: BEST IN CLASS, 97 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Napa Valley Petite Sirah
item.description: Vineyard NotesThere is no doubt that our Petite Sirah is here to make a statement. It is bursting with ripe fruit character, reflective of the grapes that were sourced from some of our favorite vineyards: Oles Vineyard in St. Helena AVA, Allias Vineyard located in Rutherford, and Mounts Vineyard over in Dry Creek Valley. Though these vineyards are found in different viticultural regions, they are all optimally located near coastal mountain ranges which serve as a conduit for the cool costal air and fog to come in at night. While long, warm days allow for the fruit to fully ripen, the evenings allow grapes to mature slowly and retain the perfect acidity and balance.
item.summary: 93 POINTS - Ken's Wine Guide

item.title: 2021 Napa Valley Syrah
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2021 Napa Valley Syrah utilizes four different clones that are grown in three different appellations throughout Napa Valley. With careful consideration we’ve planted each clone in its optimal climate so that our finished wine displays beautiful aromatics with rich full-bodied complexity and strong tannin structure.Vittorio’s Vineyard (clones 470 and 383) in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years.Just down the road in Yountville at Carsi Vineyard (clone 174) named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace- the Italian hillside village of Carsi there is a combination of soil types and microclimates that make this location perfect for growing different varietals.Last but certainly not least we have a single acre of Syrah planted at our estate ranch in Mt. Veeder (clone 877) where the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly developing incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes.
item.summary: 94 POINTS & "HIDDEN GEM" - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2021 Prestige Cuvée Brut
item.description: Vineyard Notes:For our 2021 Prestige Cuvée Brut we used a blend of 77% Chardonnay and 23% Pinot Noir from grapes that were grown in Napa Valley. This appellation is the perfect climate for producing high quality sparkling wines because of the cooling influence of the San Francisco Bay. The moderate coastal climate allows the grapes to ripen slowly and retain their acidity levels an essential quality needed for sparkling wines. Winemaking Notes: The grapes are hand-harvested at night into ½ ton bins arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the “free run juice” is separated from the “press juice”. The juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks. After primary fermentation the resulting wine is “bone dry” (no residual grape sugar) then the “Tirage” bottling occurs where it undergoes the secondary fermentation in the bottle following the French “Method Champenoise”. Following the aging process bottles are transferred into riddling bins where they undergo a month long process of slight turns which gradually move the yeast lees to the cork. Once completed the bottles undergo the disgorging process where they are inverted the necks frozen to ensure the sediment is removed and then finished with the cork and packaging. At this point the champagne is ready to be enjoyed!
item.summary: BEST OF SHOW SPARKLING WINE; 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Preston Vineyard is located in the Rutherford Appellation, where some of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. This was one of the first cabernet vineyards that Dario Sattui was drawn to in the early years. It is a very small region of Napa, known for its gravelly soils which produce rich, alluring and opulent red wines with fine-grained tannins and incredible complexity. The alluvial soils from Mount St. John have washed down from the hills over millennia to create a unique layering of weathered rock and gravel mixed with clay. The vines are 40-plus years old, 10’ X 8’ spacing and trained to a divided canopy, or “Quad”. The trellis allows ample light penetration on the fruit creating perfect flavor development and excellent maturity in the grapes at harvest.
item.summary: 94 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Quaglia Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Tiny Quaglia (Italian for “quail”) Vineyard is actually two separate parcels in St. Helena about a mile apart. One parcel is on Spring Street on the west side of town; the other is on Pratt Avenue just north of town. When Ray Quaglia's forefathers acquired this land in the early 1930’s it had already been farmed for fifty years by the Valley's early Italian growers. Back in the day it was customary to plant "field blends"; different grape varieties alongside each other, which when picked altogether produced the blend that was desired in the bottle. Most of the vines are Zinfandel but there are varying amounts of Petite Sirah and Carignane throughout the vineyard as well for added color and flavor complexity.
item.summary: 90 POINTS - James Suckling

item.title: 2021 Ramazzotti Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes: The head-trained vines from Ramazzotti Vineyard, located in Sonoma County’s Dry Creek Valley, were planted in 1982 from the Mazzoni clone, thought to be one of the original heritage clones dating back to the mid- 19th century. It is on a southwest-facing slope above the fog line, allowing the afternoon sun to fully ripen the grapes. Its shallow soil and an impenetrable layer of rock below naturally balance the vines, so they’ve never overproduce. Although the yields per acre were minuscule, the resulting wines are expansive works of art.
item.summary: 93 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2021 Russian River Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes The Russian River Valley is strongly influenced by two key factors: weather and geology. The coastal influence from the Pacific Ocean moderates the temperatures as much as 35 to 40 degrees from its daytime high. This climate promotes full flavor maturity over an extended growing season, while allowing the fruit to retain its natural acidity. The combination of fractured sandstone and sandy loam soils allow the vineyards to retain water and heat, which help to produce smooth, round wines with less acidity that are highly aromatic.
item.summary: 92 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2021 School House Creek Zinfandel
item.description:
Vineyard Notes:To combat the loss of heritage vineyards in the California, is to buy them. Fortunately, we were given this opportunity in 2023 when we became the new owners of School House Creek Vineyard, a 13.5 acre, dry-farmed vineyard mostly planted in the early 70s, with a smaller portion dating back to the 1950s.
The vineyard is located 800 feet above Dry Creek Road, about 12 miles to the west from Healdsburg in Sonoma County. Its south-facing slopes give the old vines all day sun; while it’s natural, head-pruning provides a healthy canopy that shades the berries from the direct sunlight. These old vines have never been irrigated and rely on an underground creek (School House Creek) located over 20 feet below ground level.
We are honored and privileged to be the stewards of this heritage vineyard; and proud that in a small way, we are doing our part to save California Zinfandel. The vines were planted in 1972 to St. George rootstock and are head-trained at 10’ by 8’ spacing. The soils consist of weathered gravelly loam on a well-drained alluvial bench above the valley floor. They are “dry-farmed”, meaning grown without irrigation, which limits vine growth but intensifies the flavor.
item.summary: BEST ZINFANDEL, 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2021 Vangone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Vangone Vineyard is located on top of a narrow eastern bench high above the Napa Valley, 1200 feet above the valley floor. This unique vineyard site features gravelly, volcanic soils and a southwestern facing sun exposure. To match site and soil conditions, Cabernet clones 191, 4 and 169 were densely planted on 6’ x 4’ spacing to ensure ideal terroir for top quality Mountain Cabernet.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton Loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’ and rows are slightly north of east-west and grown to a VSP trellis. These well-drained gravelly soils promote early-ripening and optimum maturity and they are often the first Cabernet grapes of the harvest. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2021 Vittorio's Vineyard Petit Verdot
item.description: Vineyard NotesOur Petit Verdot grapes are actually grown on property at our estate vineyard, Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena. This property was named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather, who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’, and rows are slightly North of East-West and grown to a VSP trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & "CELLAR SELECTION" - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2022 Another World Pinot Noir
item.description: Same gorgeous wine... new name!Wine is of a place. The wines we have created from Boonville and the Anderson Valley are singular and reflect the terroir, its beauty, and stunning landscapes. These wines also reflect a place that seems a world away from Napa and the Bay Area. It is fitting that we have renamed our Boonville Vineyard to Another World Vineyard, a name that captures the uniqueness and beauty of this gorgeous place on earth. The vineyard is located just on the outskirts of the small, and quirky town of Boonville; Any town that has its own jargon called Boontling created in the late 1800s is deserving of being labeled as quirky. Visiting Anderson Valley is like being in Another World and is worth every twist and hairpin curve for 28 miles! "Bahl Hornin" ("It's good drinkin" in Boontling) is what we think of the wines from this special place.Vineyard Notes:The grapes for this wine are grown in Anderson Valley, which is only about 16 miles long and up to 1½ miles wide, surrounded on three sides by rolling hills and low mountains and open to the west through majestic old- and second-growth redwoods to the Pacific Ocean along the Navarro River. With the coastal influence keeping temperatures cool, grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop their characteristically exotic flavors over time while preserving acidity. This vineyard is planted utilizing a VSP trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.
item.summary:
NEW VINTAGE & NEW VINEYARD NAME
92 POINTS & GOLD - Monterey Int'l. Wine Competition

item.title: 2022 Bacci Bianco
item.description: Vineyard Notes Our 2022 Bacci Bianco is made from a delightful blend of our estate vineyard fruit. A majority of which comes from Hibbard Ranch (82%) located in Los Carneros. This appellation lies on the border of both Napa and Sonoma Counties, but unlike other cool-climate AVA’s in Sonoma County, Los Carneros receives much less rainfall, and it is farther from the ocean. We also chose to incorporate a touch of fruit (18%) from our estate vineyard in Solano County. This county lies just South of Napa County, and is known for its alluvial soils, deposited on the flat valley floors over many years by rivers running through the area. Solano County enjoys a maritime climate due to the close proximity of the Sacramento Delta. Ocean breezes and fog from both Suisun Bay and San Pablo Bay help to cool the vineyards, which extends the growing season and leads to grapes that produce balanced wines with good acidity and phenolic ripeness.

item.title: 2022 Bacci Rosato
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our bright and refreshing Bacci Rosato is composed from a blend of grapes we’ve from our estate vineyards along the California coast and Napa Valley. With the coastal influence of the Pacific Ocean and San Pablo Bay keeping temperatures cool, grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop fruit flavors over time while preserving acidity.

item.title: 2022 Collina D' Oro Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard:Our Estate vineyard Collina d'Oro rests in the Russian River Valley within Sonoma County. This site is perfectly suited for Chardonnay due to the coastal fog influence and the "Gold Ridge" sandy loam soils. The vineyard gets its name from these soils which means "Hills of Gold" in Italian. The Russian River Valley is strongly influenced by two key factors: weather and geology. The coastal influence from the Pacific Ocean moderates the temperatures as much as 35 to 40 degrees from its daytime high. This climate promotes full flavor maturity over an extended growing season, while allowing the fruit to retain its natural acidity. The combination of fractured sandstone and sandy loam soils allow the vineyards to retain water and heat, which help to produce smooth, round wines with less acidity that are highly aromatic.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2022 Collina D'oro Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Collina d’Oro Vineyard is located in the Russian River AVA in Sonoma County. This region is famous for its unique “Gold Ridge soils and cool coastal influence, perfect for Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. The Russian River Valley is strongly influenced by two key factors; weather and geology. The coastal influence from the Pacific Ocean moderates the temperatures as much as 35 to 40 degrees from its daytime high. This climate promotes full flavor maturity over an extended growing season, while allowing the fruit to retain its natural acidity. The combination of fractured sandstone and sandy loam soils allow the vineyards to retain water and heat, which help to produce smooth, round wines with less acidity that are highly aromatic.
item.summary: BEST PINOT NOIR, 94 POINTS & PLATINUM - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2022 Dry Riesling
item.description: Vineyard NotesOur 2022 Mt. Veeder Dry Riesling was produced from a single vineyard block located at our estate property Hibbard Ranch. While a section of this estate falls in the Los Carneros designated appellation a small portion of our upper blocks are in the separate sub-appellation of Mt. Veeder which lies above the fog line. The rugged mountain elevations have complex marine Franciscan Formation soils with metamorphosed marine sediments such as Haire loam Cole silt loam Fagan clay loam and Felton gravelly loam with small amounts of more recent Sonoma Volcanic soils. The cool Mt. Veeder appellation overlooking the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly developing incredibly rich concentrated flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes.
item.summary: BEST RIESLING; 94 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l. Wine Competition

item.title: 2022 Gamay Rouge
item.description:
About V. Sattui's Gamay Rouge Gamay is a grape variety predominantly grown in Burgundy, specifically in the Beaujolais region. Known for producing fruity, low-tannin, and easy-drinking wines, Gamay is often associated with Beaujolais Nouveau and Beaujolais-Villages wines.
At V. Sattui Winery, our Gamay Rouge is crafted from the Valdiguié grape, introduced to California in the 1970s and initially misnamed as Napa Gamay due to its similar wine style to true Gamay from Beaujolais. Valdiguié, originating from southwestern France, gained popularity in California for producing wines reminiscent of Beaujolais, which were trendy at the time.
With regulations now preventing the use of the Napa Gamay name, we have trademarked Gamay Rouge as our proprietary name. This allows us to honor the grape's history and its unique Californian adaptation while continuing to offer a distinctive, enjoyable wine experience.Vineyard Notes:The Gamay Noir grapes we source for this bright refreshing wine are from our estate vineyard on Solano County. This varietal is most famous for producing the light, effervescent, fruit forward red wines of Beaujolais in eastern France. Characteristically these wines see no barrel aging at all and are enjoyed only weeks after harvest when they are fresh and vibrant. To honor tradition and pay homage to this varietal’s heritage we pick these grapes when they are lower in sugars and higher in acids to preserve the freshness and capture it in bottle to be enjoyed in any season.
item.summary: Fan Favorite!

item.title: 2022 Los Carneros Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Our 2022 Los Carneros Chardonnay was crafted using fruit from our estate vineyard, Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This cool appellation overlooks the San Pablo Bay, where summer average temperatures range from 50º to 90ºF, making it an ideal site for Burgundian varietals. The cool summer nights allow the fruit to retain its acidity while warmer days bring the maturity to perfection. These vines are farmed utilizing a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.
item.summary: 93 POINTS - James Suckling

item.title: 2022 Los Carneros Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2022 Los Carneros Pinot Noir is a glorious representation of this world-renowned viticultural area. The fruit for this wine comes from our estate vineyard, Hibbard Ranch, located along Carneros Creek and adjacent to the Mt. Veeder AVA. It is planted to four different clones, Dijon selections 115 and 777, clone 828 and Pommard clone 5, all grafted to 44-53 rootstocks on a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system. The VSP trellis forces clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions. Summer average temperatures range from 50ºF to 90ºF which makes it an ideal site for these varietals. Cool summer nights retain the acidity and hot days bring the maturity to perfection.
item.summary: 91 POINTS & GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2022 Muscat
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our highly unique 2022 Muscat is crafted from a blend of our estate grown grapes in Solono County. This county lies just South of Napa County, and is known for its alluvial soils, deposited on the flat valley floors over many years by rivers running through the area. Solano County enjoys a maritime climate due to the close proximity of the Sacramento Delta. Ocean breezes and fog from both Suisun Bay and San Pablo Bay help to cool the vineyards, which extends the growing season and leads to grapes that produce balanced wines with good acidity and phenolic ripeness.

item.title: 2022 Napa Valley Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Our 2022 Napa Valley Chardonnay is made from a delightful blend of our estate vineyard fruit.
item.summary: BEST CHARDONNAY, 95 POINTS, & PLATINUM - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2022 Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2022 Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc is a refreshing blend that showcases our estate vineyard fruit. A majority (55%) of the blend comes from Carsi Vineyard located in Yountville. It is a 27-acre vineyard named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. This appellation is one of the coolest wine growing regions in Napa Valley, which contributes to a long growing season and full-flavored fruit.The remainder of the blend (45%) is sourced from just down the road at Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This appellation lies on the border of both Napa and Sonoma Counties, but unlike other cool-climate AVAs in Sonoma County, Los Carneros receives much less rainfall, and it is farther from the ocean. The area’s dense, clay soils are not particularly deep or fertile, and these factors when combined produce fruit with concentrated flavors.

item.title: 2022 Napa Valley Semillon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2022 Napa Valley Semillon sources fruit from two of our estate properties, Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros (90%, Semillon) and Carsi Vineyard (10%, Sauvignon Blanc), located in the town of Yountville. With the coastal influence of the bay keeping temperatures cool, and chance of late-season rain minimal, grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop fruit flavors over time while preserving acidity. These vineyards utilize a VSP trellis system for their vines, which forces clusters of fruit to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance ripening under cool climate conditions.

item.title: 2022 Off-dry Riesling
item.description: Vineyard NotesFor our 2022 Off-Dry Riesling, we decided that to best capture the essence of California, we would combine the grapes grown from our estate vineyard in Anderson Valley, with fruit from another well-known coastal climate Santa Barbara County. With the coastal influence keeping temperatures cool, grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop their characteristically exotic flavors over time while preserving acidity. Both vineyards are planted utilizing a VSP trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increases their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.
item.summary: 92 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2022 Reserve Stock Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:For our 2022 Reserve Stock Pinot Noir we created a blend that sourced fruit from our estate vineyards Hibbard Ranch located in Los Carneros, Napa Valley and Collina d’ Oro Vineyard, nestled along the Russian River in Sonoma County. Both appellations are in close proximity to marine climates, allowing the morning fog to inhibit significant temperature rises in the morning. With the coastal influence keeping temperatures cool, and chance of late-season rain minimal, the grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop fruit flavors over time while preserving acidity.

item.title: 2022 Rosato Di Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:We source grapes for our Rosato di Pinot Noir from one of our favorite growers in Santa Barbara County. This region boasts a rare “transverse” geography, an east-west orientation that channels cool ocean air directly across the valley floor. The result is a Mediterranean-like climate that produces one of California’s longest growing regions. This unique environment ensures the grapes mature slowly, developing incredibly rich concentrated flavors with exquisite complexity and balance.
item.summary: BEST OF CLASS - SF Chronicle Wine Competition

item.title: 2023 Albariño
item.description: Vineyard NotesOur Albariño was crafted using fruit from our estate vineyard, Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This cool appellation overlooks the San Pablo Bay, where summer average temperatures range from 50º to 90º F, making it an ideal site for Burgundian varietals. The cool summer nights allow the fruit to retain its acidity while warmer days bring the maturity to perfection.

item.title: 2023 Another World Riesling
item.description: Same gorgeous wine... new name!Wine is of a place. The wines we have created from Boonville and the Anderson Valley are singular and reflect the terroir, its beauty, and stunning landscapes. These wines also reflect a place that seems a world away from Napa and the Bay Area. It is fitting that we have renamed our Boonville Vineyard to Another World Vineyard, a name that captures the uniqueness and beauty of this gorgeous place on earth. The vineyard is located just on the outskirts of the small, and quirky town of Boonville; Any town that has its own jargon called Boontling created in the late 1800s is deserving of being labeled as quirky. Visiting Anderson Valley is like being in Another World and is worth every twist and hairpin curve for 28 miles! "Bahl Hornin" ("It's good drinkin" in Boontling) is what we think of the wines from this special place.Vineyard Notes:The grapes for this wine are grown in Anderson Valley, which is only about 16 miles long and up to 1½ miles wide, surrounded on three sides by rolling hills and low mountains and open to the west through majestic old- and second-growth redwoods to the Pacific Ocean along the Navarro River. With the coastal influence keeping temperatures cool, grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop their characteristically exotic flavors over time while preserving acidity. This vineyard is planted utilizing a VSP trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.
item.summary: DOUBLE GOLD - SF Chronicle Wine Competition

item.title: 2023 Moscato
item.description: Vineyard Notes:While the translation of this wine from Italian to the English language may be simple, “Muscat Sparkling,” this wine is anything but simplistic. We crafted this sparkling, sweet delight from 75% of our estate grown Muscat while supplementing the remainder of the blend with fruit from one of our beloved growers in Anderson Valley. Fruit from both vineyard locations benefit from a transverse mountain range topography (East to West) with varying soil types, and a collage of microclimates that keep the regions cool. The chill of the fog and breezes from the ocean help extend the growing season, allowing the grapes to fully riper without excessive sugar levels- a key factor behind what makes this wine so elegant and unique.

item.title: 2023 Tre Uve Bianco
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Tre Uve Bianco (Italian for “three white grapes”) is our newest addition to the V. Sattui family. This delightfully, refreshing white blend is the result of harmonizing three very exciting varietals into one wine: Chenin Blanc, Albariño, and Pinot Grigio. These are the newest grapes to be grown at our estate vineyard Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This renowned growing region’s cool summer nights allow the fruit to retain its acidity while warmer days bring the maturity to perfection.
item.summary: NEW VINTAGE!

item.title: Angelica
item.description: Angelica is a fortified wine traditionally associated with the Mission grape from which it was made since the early days of California winemaking. V. Sattui instead uses the fresh juice of the Muscat of Alexandria grape and enhances it with brandy.Angelica is a full-bodied and elegant liqueur-like wine. It's sweeter than most ports with a light amber to pale-salmon color and a smooth silky mouthfeel. We arrest the fermentation of the wine at an early stage with the addition of an almost 20-year-old pot-still brandy from Carneros causing the grapes to retain the maximum of their sugar content around 15% residual and an alcohol of about 18%. Store in a cool spot chill in the refrigerator just before opening and serve as an aperitif or dessert wine. After opening it will keep well in the refrigerator for weeks or months.
item.summary: 92.5 POINTS - Ken's Wine Guide

item.title: Brandy - Aged In Madeira Barrels
item.description: Unique flavors and a rich history of wines dating all the way back to 1885 are imparted by aging our brandy in Madeira barrels. This enticing spirit is a deep honey hue, indicative of the rich aromas and flavors within – all 100% naturally derived from the solera oak.
item.summary: *This product is only available for purchase and pickup at V. Sattui Winery.

item.title: Madeira
item.description: Winemaking Notes:The solera process is an ingenious system of fractional blending perfected by the Spanish to ensure consistent quality based on the fact that old wines can be refreshed by the addition of a younger wine which then acquires the characteristics of the old wine. We begin with now what is now a 107-year-old vintage port, a lasting vestige from Vittorio Sattui's original winery as the mother (or master-blend). We then fashion primary secondary and tertiary blends "criaderas" using varying ages of Zinfandel - the oldest is more than 35 years old - and add a little back to the mother to keep it alive much like sourdough breadmaking. Over the years our Madeira has won a chest-full of Gold Medals and accolades. A noted wine columnist for the Times and Star in the U.K. Gerald Richardson wrote: “V. Sattui Madeira…is without a doubt the best Madeira in the world…”LEARN MORE ABOUT WHAT MAKES OUR MADEIRA SPECIAL:HOW TO OPEN A BOTTLE OF MADEIRA:STORING MADEIRA: Although our Madeira will age up to several years in perfect cellar conditions after being opened, we recommend it be consumed within 1-3 years after opening. Store it upright in our cupboard like you would a spirit.
item.summary: "BEST MADEIRA IN THE WORLD" - Gerald Richardson, Times and Star, UK
